sub_title: Data Engineer & Business Analyst || MSc (Honors) TU Delft (Alum) || Civil Engineer || Planner || Big Data || Experienced with Microsoft Azure, Databricks, Power BI, Python & Matlab || Business Innovation and Strategy
summary:
Data Engineer at Mapiq, Netherlands. Master graduate with Honours from Technical University of Delft, Netherlands.  Passionate in solving challenging societal problems with core interest in data analysis, business intelligence, intelligent and smart mobility, understanding human behaviour and modelling. 

Always looking to collaborate and help analyse challenging problems in a sustainable, efficient and in an economical way as possible.

Few of my achievements include, Excellence Scholarship holder at TU Delft, Gold medalist (Civil Engg 2014-18) with Honours, DAAD Wise Scholar 2017,  Indian Academy of Sciences Scholar 2016,  Secured Gold Medal in the first academic year, four years of Research Experience in various fields of Transportation and Civil Engineering, Department topper, Vice President of R&D club of Civil Engineering Department, Events Head of Civil Engineering Association(CEA) in my bachelor's.

treasury_media.title: Presented a Webinar for Young Researchers
treasury_media.description: Conducted a workshop on Mobility and Safety for master and bachelor student of Chennai Institute of Technology with a participation of more than 200 students.

treasury_media.title: Conducted a Workshop on Recent Advancements in Civil Engineering and Future Perspectives
treasury_media.description: Presented a 3-hour training program for 500 civil engineering bachelor students specially focused on the recent advancements in the field of Transport and Traffic Safety

education.field_of_study: Program in Statistics and Data Science (Online)

awards.title: Physio Chemical Treatment of Water and Waste Waster Supply
awards.description: This was a first course offered for the selected B-Tech students, and secured the top grade 'S' and gained a lot of experience and knowledge in designing a complete waste water treatment system.

awards.title: Gold Medalist, 1st B-Tech
awards.description: Was Awarded with Gold medal for securing first position in Academic curriculum of 1st Year, B-Tech NIT-Trichy!

awards.title: Truss Bridge Design
awards.description:
Our team bagged the first position out of the 60 colleges participated in a National level technical festival organised by National Institute of technology, Calicut!
The problem statement was to design a Truss Bridge, which can withstand maximum load. And the efficiency was calculated as the ratio between the breaking load and the weight of the bridge. We also got a cash award of rupees 6000.

projects.title: Chimney Design for Lateral Stability
projects.description:
This was a part of a event at IIT Bombay, which was held during their technical festival.
We were asked to construct a Chimney using wooden sticks and a prescribed foundation which will resist lateral load. Also there was a many constraints in the fixing and for foundation of the chimney.

projects.title: Design and analysis of an Intelligent autonomous vehicle system
projects.description: The system designed will improve the situational awareness of the driver and alert the driver based on the situation with various alert signals. Additionally, it can also take necessary safety action depending upon the state of the driver. This research was carried out for a period of 3 months Prof. Meng Wang.

projects.title: Safety effects and behavioral changes on implementation of helmets to the cyclist of Netherlands
projects.description: This work was carried out for a period of two months with the supervision of Prof. Haneen and Prof. Marjan. I worked on a detailed methodology for a naturalistic data collection of cyclists and analysing their behaviour and safety effects before and after helmet usage.

projects.description: The main goal of this paper is to present the social cost benefits of implementing the mandatory helmets. The research work was mentored and supervised by Prof. J.A.Annema for a period of 3 months.

projects.title: Road Pricing Implementation scheme for the Netherlands
projects.description: The central idea of this research project is to reduce the congestion and environmental effects of the overgrowing vehicle use by implementing a road pricing strategy. This design project was supervised and completed under the guidance of Prof. Alexander Verbraeck, Prof. J.A.Annema and Prof. J.W.C. van Lint. The design includes an innovative technical, social and politically feasible design keeping the present and future scenarios of the Netherlands.

projects.title: Numerical Analysis of CAVITATION in rubber like material
projects.description:
This Research Internship was funded by the DAAD WISE Scholarship to pursue my research at TU Darmstadt under prof. Dr. Jens Schiender in the Institute of Stuctural Mechanics and Design.
My project work is based on the numerical studies of the cavitation effects in rubber like material and fracture mechanics related to it.

projects.title: Soil stabilization using Human hair and Recyclable Plastic.
projects.description: It was an On-Semester Research project, in which we tried to improve the Soil Bearing Capacity using dry human hair and also with Recycle plastic material with a suitable Aspect ratio! This yielded a good results and increased the strength close to 70 percent of the strength of the virgin soil.

projects.description: It was a Research Fellowship offered to me by Indian Academy of Sciences ,too work for a period of too Months under the prof Dr. Devdas Menon from IIT-Madras. I worked in Thermal Analysis of structural members under a Uniform thermal gradient and plotted the BMDs and SFDs of the members and did the same for Portal Frame using MATLAB software.

projects.title: Rotating Boat lift
projects.description:
A new model has been proposed which can simultaneously lift four boats present in a water body from a lower elevation to an higher elevation.
It was presented in the Technical fest of NIT-Trichy
It was mainly used to take the boat from one level to another level with different elevation. 
It was also equipped with two special independent gear systems, which can rotate independent with each other, so that it can be used to carry even a single boat or up-to four boats, with maximum efficiency and minimum time.

profile_positions.description:
My main role and responsibilities include: 
- Defining/Creating the overall data architecture based on the business goals 
- Create and deploy batch/streaming data pipelines in Azure Data Bricks and Azure Data Factory (ADF)
- Implement Data Governance with the UNITY catalog
- Recommend best practices and optimize costs with various tools and services
profile_positions.title: Data Engineer

profile_positions.description:
As a Data Engineer, I focus on, 
- Unwrapping the complex data to transform and create meaningful insights for our company, clients and customers
- Create an efficient and effective Data Warehouse using Microsoft Azure
- Build and Manage the data pipelines and flows in the Azure data factory and Azure Data Bricks
- Analyse data for various use-cases and create dashboards using Power BI
- Creating Machine Learning Models and applying various Predictive Algorithms 
- Explored Feature Engineering and Hyper-parameter tuning for predictions
profile_positions.title: Data Engineer

profile_positions.description: Understanding the behaviour and safety of Cyclists and Moped Users at T-Intersection, through a field study conducted using video camera surveillance.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher

profile_positions.description: The project is related to the interactions of car drivers and pedestrians at crossings. Initially, I will be modelling the driver and pedestrian behaviour and using the results I will design changes in the infrastructure and recommend new policy measures for the safety improvements of the pedestrians.

profile_positions.description: MSc (Honours) specialised in the field of Transportation Infrastructure and Logistics.

profile_positions.description: The main goal of the project was to analyse Travel Behaviour using Artificial Intelligence. Developed a Python code for generating Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) to learn the patterns and then applied for modelling the road-user behaviour.

profile_positions.description: It is a part of my Honours Program Masters, which mainly deals with the analysing the personality traits in relation to the trust related to Autonomous driving systems.

profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

company.name: The Zonal Railway Training Institute of southern Railway, Tiruchirappalli

profile_positions.company: The Zonal Railway Training Institute of southern Railway, Tiruchirappalli
profile_positions.description: We have visited The Zonal Railway Training Institute of Southern Railway of Tiruchrappalli on Thursday, 10th of November. This Institute was started  on 19th February 2007 as a Platinum Jubilee Memorial. A Railway Staff guided us throughout this IV, he gave a very good introduction about Indian Railways and their scope, future development, current problems faced by Railways etc, then he led us to a model room. The institute had working models of Semaphore Signals, Colour Aspect Signals, CTC (Centrailized Train Control System), Absolute and Automatic Block System. There was also a real working model of the Points and Crossings.
profile_positions.title: In-Plant Trainee

profile_positions.description: It's a Research Fellowship, got full funding from the Indian Academy of Sciences, worked under one of the best Prof at IITM, Dr Devdas Menon for a period of two months. Research topic was based on Thermal Analysis of structural members under a Uniform Thermal Gradient.
